commands.name: az network lb create
commands.syntax:
az network lb create --name
                     --resource-group
                     [--backend-pool-name]
                     [--edge-zone]
                     [--frontend-ip-name]
                     [--frontend-ip-zone]
                     [--location]
                     [--no-wait]
                     [--private-ip-address]
                     [--private-ip-address-version {IPv4, IPv6}]
                     [--public-ip-address]
                     [--public-ip-address-allocation {Dynamic, Static}]
                     [--public-ip-dns-name]
                     [--public-ip-zone]
                     [--sku {Basic, Gateway, Standard}]
                     [--subnet]
                     [--subnet-address-prefix]
                     [--tags]
                     [--validate]
                     [--vnet-address-prefix]
                     [--vnet-name]
examples: az network lb create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyLb --sku Basic
az network lb create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyLb --sku Basic --vnet-name MyVnet --subnet MySubnet
az network lb create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyLb --sku Basic --subnet {subnetID}
az network lb create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyLb --sku Basic --public-ip-zone 2
az network lb create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyLb --sku Standard --frontend-ip-zone 1 --vnet-name MyVnet --subnet MySubnet

commands.name: az network lb delete
commands.syntax:
az network lb delete [--ids]
                     [--name]
                     [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                     [--resource-group]
                     [--subscription]
examples: az network lb delete -g MyResourceGroup -n MyLb

commands.name: az network lb list-mapping
commands.summary: List inbound NAT rule port mappings.
examples: az network lb list-mapping -n MyLb -g MyResourceGroup --backend-pool-name MyAddressPool --request ip=XX
az network lb list-mapping -n MyLb -g MyResourceGroup --backend-pool-name MyAddressPool --request nic=XX

commands.name: az network lb list-nic
commands.summary: List associated load balancer network interfaces.
examples: az network lb list-nic -g MyResourceGroup --name MyLb

commands.name: az network lb show
commands.summary: Get the details of a load balancer.
examples: az network lb show -g MyResourceGroup -n MyLb

commands.name: az network lb update
commands.syntax:
az network lb update [--add]
                     [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                     [--ids]
                     [--name]
                     [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                     [--probes]
                     [--remove]
                     [--resource-group]
                     [--set]
                     [--subscription]
                     [--tags]
examples: az network lb update -g MyResourceGroup -n MyLB --tags CostCenter=MyTestGroup

commands.name: az network lb wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
